00023 // File          : gzstream.h
00024 // Revision      : $Revision: 1.5 $
00025 // Revision_date : $Date: 2002/04/26 23:30:15 $
00026 // Author(s)     : Deepak Bandyopadhyay, Lutz Kettner

00031 // 
00032 // Standard streambuf implementation following Nicolai Josuttis, "The 
00033 // Standard C++ Library".
00034 // ============================================================================
00035 
00036 #ifndef GZSTREAM_H
00037 #define GZSTREAM_H 1
00038 
00039 // standard C++ with new header file names and std:: namespace
00040 #include <iostream>
00041 #include <fstream>
00042 #include <zlib.h>
00043 
00044 #ifdef GZSTREAM_NAMESPACE
00045 namespace GZSTREAM_NAMESPACE {
00046 #endif
00047 
00048 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00049 // Internal classes to implement gzstream. See below for user classes.
00050 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00051 
00052 class gzstreambuf : public std::streambuf {
00053 private:
00054     static const int bufferSize = 47+256;    // size of data buff
00055     // totals 512 bytes under g++ for igzstream at the end.
00056 
00057     gzFile           file;               // file handle for compressed file
00058     char             buffer[bufferSize]; // data buffer
00059     char             opened;             // open/close state of stream
00060     int              mode;               // I/O mode
00061 
00062     int flush_buffer();
00063 public:
00064     gzstreambuf() : opened(0) {
00065         setp( buffer, buffer + (bufferSize-1));
00066         setg( buffer + 4,     // beginning of putback area
00067               buffer + 4,     // read position
00068               buffer + 4);    // end position      
00069         // ASSERT: both input & output capabilities will not be used together
00070     }
00071     int is_open() { return opened; }
00072     gzstreambuf* open( const char* name, int open_mode);
00073     gzstreambuf* close();
00074     ~gzstreambuf() { close(); }
00075     
00076     virtual int     overflow( int c = EOF);
00077     virtual int     underflow();
00078     virtual int     sync();
00079 };
00080 
00081 class gzstreambase : virtual public std::ios {
00082 protected:
00083     gzstreambuf buf;
00084 public:
00085     gzstreambase() { init(&buf); }
00086     gzstreambase( const char* name, int open_mode);
00087     ~gzstreambase();
00088     void open( const char* name, int open_mode);
00089     void close();
00090     gzstreambuf* rdbuf() { return &buf; }
00091 };
00092 
00093 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00094 // User classes. Use igzstream and ogzstream analogously to ifstream and
00095 // ofstream respectively. They read and write files based on the gz* 
00096 // function interface of the zlib. Files are compatible with gzip compression.
00097 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00098 
00099 class igzstream : public gzstreambase, public std::istream {
00100 public:
00101     igzstream() : std::istream( &buf) {} 
00102     igzstream( const char* name, int open_mode = std::ios::in)
00103         : gzstreambase( name, open_mode), std::istream( &buf) {}  
00104     gzstreambuf* rdbuf() { return gzstreambase::rdbuf(); }
00105     void open( const char* name, int open_mode = std::ios::in) {
00106         gzstreambase::open( name, open_mode);
00107     }
00108 };
00109 
00110 class ogzstream : public gzstreambase, public std::ostream {
00111 public:
00112     ogzstream() : std::ostream( &buf) {}
00113     ogzstream( const char* name, int mode = std::ios::out)
00114         : gzstreambase( name, mode), std::ostream( &buf) {}  
00115     gzstreambuf* rdbuf() { return gzstreambase::rdbuf(); }
00116     void open( const char* name, int open_mode = std::ios::out) {
00117         gzstreambase::open( name, open_mode);
00118     }
00119 };
00120 
00121 #ifdef GZSTREAM_NAMESPACE
00122 } // namespace GZSTREAM_NAMESPACE
00123 #endif
00124 
00125 #endif // GZSTREAM_H
00126 // ============================================================================
00127 // EOF //
